events.name: Designing for Multiple Screens
events.short-desc: Welcome to Style & Class! For our first ever meetup, we'll take a look at common mobile web design mistakes and how you model content for a responsive web site.

description.p: Doors open at 6:30pm, talks start at 7:00pm. No admittance after 7:15pm. An assortment of beer and soft drinks will be provided, no food. 19+, minors not permitted due to alcohol service.

talks.title: Mobile Web Design Anti-Patterns
Content Modelling for Responsive Web Design

events.name: Content Creation and Perceived Performance
events.short-desc: In our November meetup, we'll hear about the challenges of pushing the boundaries in web design with creaky old content management systems, and the importance of how your users perceive the performance of your site.

description.p: Doors open at 6:30pm, talks start at 7:00pm. No admittance after 7:15pm. An assortment of beer and soft drinks will be provided, no food. 19+, minors not permitted due to alcohol service.

talks.title: Design Problems for Next-Generation Content Creation Interfaces
A Beginner's Guide to Perceived Performance

events.name: Contentious Content
events.short-desc: Content comes in many different forms. Our January event will focus in on content-based images and the importance of a sound content strategy.

description.p: Doors open at 6:30pm, talks start at 7:00pm. No admittance after 7:15pm. An assortment of beer and soft drinks will be provided, no food. 19+, minors not permitted due to alcohol service.

talks.title: Contentious Images: Handling Images for the Mobile Web
Content Strategy for Designers

events.name: Developing Design
events.short-desc: Our March event begins with a regular length talk on designers and developers working together, followed by 5 minute lightning talks about some of the latest and greatest tools for designers and front-end developers alike.

description.p: Doors open at 6:30pm, talks start at 7:00pm. No admittance after 7:15pm. An assortment of beer and soft drinks will be provided, no food. 19+, minors not permitted due to alcohol service.

talks.title: Design as a Story
Photoshop's Magical Smart Filters
Jumpstart into Multi-Device Testing
Dynamic Visuals with SVG
Analyzing Existing Design Styles on the Web
Anal Retentive Photoshop Habits: Improve Your Flow Without Making a Mess

events.name: Making the Web for Everyone
events.short-desc: Who are you building for? Different audiences require different design considerations. For our May event, we'll hear about CSS best practices for building accessible sites and creating scalable, maintainable CSS at the enterprise level.

description.p: Doors open at 6:30pm, talks start at 7:00pm. No admittance after 7:15pm. An assortment of beer and soft drinks will be provided, no food. 19+, minors not permitted due to alcohol service.

talks.title: Accessibility with CSS: Making Websites Better for Everyone
CSS Enterprise: A Five Year Mission

events.afterwards: We tend to head to Craft Beer Market after the event to have some more drinks and some more nuanced conversation. If you can make it, we'd love to see you there!

events.name: Designing Your Design Process
events.short-desc: Our July event focuses on the design process within product development, with talks on frameworks for thinking about UX and the design process in an Agile software environment.

description.p: Doors open at 6:30pm, talks start at 7:00pm. No admittance after 7:15pm. An assortment of beer and soft drinks will be provided, no food. 19+, minors not permitted due to alcohol service.

talks.title: Frameworks for UX Thinking
Designing Under The Agile Fog of War

events.afterwards: We tend to head to Craft Beer Market after the event to have some more drinks and some more nuanced conversation. If you can make it, we'd love to see you there!

events.name: Lessons from Coding In The Real World
events.short-desc: Our September event features two regular length talks on coding lessons learned in the field. Come celebrate our first anniversary with talks on reusable CSS and truly responsive images.

description.p: Doors open at 6:30pm, talks start at 7:00pm. No admittance after 7:15pm. An assortment of beer and soft drinks will be provided, no food. 19+, minors not permitted due to alcohol service.

talks.title: Modular CSS - Best Practices for Using CSS Components in the Real World
<picture this> - Your Images, Responsive

events.afterwards: We tend to head to Tap & Barrel after the event to have some more drinks and some more nuanced conversation. If you can make it, we'd love to see you there!

events.name: The Style & Class Conference
events.short-desc: We’ve taken everything you love about our meetups, the heart and soul, and partnered with two amazing organizations, Smashing Conference and Ladies Learning Code, to create an incredible day of high-quality conference talks.

description.p: We’ve taken everything you love about our meetups, the heart and soul, and partnered with two amazing organizations, Smashing Conference and Ladies Learning Code, to create an incredible day of high-quality conference talks.

Tickets are only $20 and we’re donating all profits to Ladies Learning Code, a Canada-wide not-for-profit group working to empower everyone to feel comfortable learning beginner-friendly technical skills in a social, collaborative way. We have a limited numbers of tickets and Style and Class always sells out, so get yours now!
Doors open at 12:00pm (noon) and talks get rolling at 1pm.

events.accessibility: The Style & Class Conference will be accessible for the hearing impaired.

talks.title: All The Right Moves: Putting your UIs in Motion
Content Strategy For Designers
Improving Smashing Magazine's Performance: A Case-Study
Peer Influence, Pop Culture, and the Power of Human-Centred Design
Accessibility With CSS: Making Websites Better for Everyone
15 Years of Responsive Web Design

events.sponsor-description: Without the support of sponsors and partners, this event would be nearly impossible to organize and run. A huge thanks for their generous support of a community event!
events.afterparty: The Style & Class Conference After Party

events.name: The Style & Class Conference After Party

description.p: Doors open at 7pm. Drinks and light snacks will be served.
